preserves green space, rather than organizing units in rigid rows like traditional subdivisions. This
approach reduces infrastructure costs by minimizing road networks and utility runs while creating
a more appealing, community-oriented environment. The natural layout works particularly well
with waterfront properties, maintaining river access and scenic views.
Volume purchasing will drive better pricing across all systems and materials. The utility
management strategy makes particular sense for investor sales - charging a flat utility fee while
benefiting from SIP efficiency creates additional revenue streams. Cluster development helps
with the elevated pier foundations required for flood compliance.
Construction costs for workforce housing typically range $120-140 per square foot, while SIP
construction commands higher pricing but Randy believes volume orders can achieve
competitive rates. A professional sales office with 3D site renderings and quality presentation
materials will demonstrate projected returns to potential investors.
Both student housing and workforce housing represent excellent market opportunities with
surprisingly robust demand. Well-constructed, attractive units should achieve rapid sellout given
the substantial unmet need in the Hattiesburg market.

Development Structure
There are many approaches to building and selling housing developments, but the condominium
structure seems most attractive for this project because the demand is there which should allow
pre-sales, and the individual unit ownership makes financing easier on the real estate developers
and property owners.

Project Overview
160 Individual Condominium Units for Sale
Cluster-style development using SIP (Structural Insulated Panel) construction. Natural layout
preserving green space and river access.
